summary: The 'Restore and Modernize Our National Laboratories Act of 2025' directs the Secretary of Energy to fund projects at National Laboratories for restoration, modernization, deferred maintenance, and infrastructure upgrades.  The Secretary must submit annual project lists to congressional committees, detailing project descriptions and funding profiles. The bill authorizes $5 billion annually from 2026-2030, with one-third designated for the Office of Science. It also mandates a strategy for facilities and infrastructure, including a report to Congress outlining a 10-year plan for laboratory reconfiguration.
